column4: I'm trying to get a wacom pen to work with Ubuntu 9.04, and it's not, but I can't figure out why, i've tried multiple instruction sites but it keeps acting like it's simply not seeing it and I don't know how to figure out why
any suggestions?
is it a tablet/pen combo or one of the "freewriter" or "freeagent" pens?
it's a pen that goes with the OQO pamtop computer, it's a Wacom Serial
sounds like it needs OEM drivers dude... MOST tablets just dont work in linux for that reason..
there are sites all over google saying "pen works fine in 8.14"
there is no such thing as 8.14 there was 8.04 8.06 8.10 and 8.10b
do me a favor and pastebin your lsusb output
I could, but it doesn't list the device, it's serial
are you sure, have you tryied? the serial bus is part of a UDB circuit on MOST comps without qpi, and so far as i know, there are no i3/i5 netbooks
this is the xorg.conf they keep saying to use: http://vefur.simula.no/~aasmundo/tmp/oqo.xorg.conf
do you see the parts that are commented out?
yeah
/dev/input/wacom is the device when it's connected via USB
uncomment them and reboot
even though the device is serial, it MAY be that the kernal is using the USB buffer for it's data, meaning it could assign a virtual USB device for communicating with the tablet
there is no /dev/input/wacom on the device for that command to find if tyhat matters
do me a favor and run touch /dev/ttyS1
no reply
ok, now try that with /dev/input/wacom
can you repost if you replied, i cant find a post after mine
none of the touch commands returned anything
